title: Drawing, "Design for a Creamer", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, red ink, graphite on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp: in black ink at center right: 163
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: CREMERA/DIAMETRE 7 cms 1/2/HAUTEUR 9 cms; at lower right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/43
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Cylindrical creamer with a flared spout drawn in plan and elevation with applied vertical bands along the back third of the body, sumounted by a circular lid decorated along the front with five applied balls; C-shaped handle indicated in red ink decorated on each side with three protruding balls  at the top and bottom where it connects to the short circular foot. Underdrawing in graphite of creamer in golden section.
circumference of the body drawn twice in plan.
